channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Don’t Miss the RPI 2024 Graduate School Expo!
item.description: Join the Center for Career and Professional Development for the RPI 2024 Graduate School Expo, scheduled to be held in the Heffner Alumni House from 1PM to 4PM on October 23! Students will have opportunities to interact directly with various graduate schools and learn more about their programs; register in Handshake to view the participating schools.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Discover Beyond the Classroom” Study Abroad Program to be Held October 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join the Office of International Programs and the School of Science Advising Hub for an enlightening presentation by the Office of International Programs staff! Attendees will delve into the incredible opportunities awaiting abroad, hear students’ first-hand experiences in a dynamic student panel, and discover how studying abroad can impact one’s academic and personal growth.
item.author: Students

item.title: Accelerated Eng/Sci + MBA Virtual Info Session Scheduled for October 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Register to attend this session to learn more about the Accelerated Engineering/Science + MBA Program, which allows Rensselaer engineering and science undergraduates to complete their Bachelor’s degree within eight or fewer semesters with the option to receive an award of up to 50% of their tuition charges during their additional semesters of MBA graduate study.
item.author: Students

item.title: ASCE Student Chapter Meeting to be Held October 22
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Attend this week’s meeting to meet RPI alum Matthew Makcuh, from McLaren Engineering Group. From concept to completion, McLaren’s full service engineering solutions balance cutting-edge innovation with a practical approach to support projects of every size, shape, scope, and complexity. Bring your resume and enjoy some refreshments with your fellow students!
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of SSTF’s Annual Litter Bug Battle!
item.description: Date: Sunday, October 27, 2024 12:00 PM - 4:00 PM - Join Rensselaer’s Student Sustainability Task Force and compete to collect the most litter around campus and in the city of Troy! Gloves, garbage bags, and refreshments will be provided. For more information on this event, stop by the Mueller Center or send an email!
item.author: Students

item.title: UPDATE Regarding October 19 Family Weekend Concert
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 19, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:30 PM - This year’s Family Weekend Concert program includes festive performances by Rensselaer’s Orchestra, Concert Choir, and Wind Symphony, and features works by Berlioz, Brahms, Copland, Respighi, and Verdi. In addition, Rensselaer Student Concerto Competition-winner Rachael Marseglia will perform the third movement from Mozart’s Flute Concerto No. 1 in G Major. NOTE THAT THE EVENT WILL START AT 6:00PM, AND NOT 7:00PM AS ORIGINALLY ANNOUNCED.
item.author: Community

item.title: Curator Katherine C.M. Adams to Lead EMPAC Tour
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 19, 2024 11:00 AM - Join Katherine C.M. Adams for a behind-the-scenes look at EMPAC’s production facilities as she discusses acoustic and visual potentials of each EMPAC venue for the making of complex performance works, including Bassem Saad and Sanja Grozdanić’s upcoming “Permanent Trespass,” an EMPAC commission premiering at the Center October 25.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Continue Graduate Certificate Review Sessions October 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for this information session highlighting the whole range of Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs. Three courses in length and able to be completed in as little as seven months, the certificates can add up to a customized, career-aligned master’s degree. Please register if you plan to attend.

item.title: HR Posts 2024 New York State Election Information Regarding Time Off to Vote
item.description: With Election Day right around the corner, Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources has some timely reminders for all faculty and staff who are registered to vote.

item.title: RPI Student’s Dreams Lift Off with Europa Clipper
item.description: When the Europa Clipper lifted off on Monday, October 14, 19-year-old Rensselaer student Brianna Casey — who spent her summer as an intern working on the project and so had a personal attachment to the spacecraft — was watching.

item.title: HR Announces Professional Development Book Discussion Series, “Everyday People, Extraordinary Leadership”
item.description: The premise of this book is quite simple: Leadership is a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. This virtual book discussion, which is scheduled to be held from 1:00PM to 2:30PM on Friday, November 22, will explore the five practices of exemplary leadership that are detailed, and participants will share their reactions to the book’s themes.
